channel.title: Decimal, Octal, Hexidecimal
channel.description:
The Java Tutorials state:
Decimal is the number system you already use every day; it's based on 10 digits, numbered 0 through 9. The octal number system is base 8, consisting of the digits 0 through 7. The hexadecimal system is base 16, whose digits are the numbers 0 through 9 and the letters A through F. For general-purpose programming, the decimal system is likely to be the only number system you'll ever use. However, if you need octal or hexadecimal, the following example shows the correct syntax. The prefix 0 indicates octal, whereas 0x indicates hexadecimal.
Now, it says that...
26 (Decimal) 032 (Octal) 0x1a (Hexidecimal)
...are all equal to 26, which I do not understand AT ALL. Anyone who can understand this care to explain?

item.title: Decimal, Octal, Hexidecimal
item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

The hexadecimal system is base 16, whose digits are the numbers 0 through 9 and the letters A through F

1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8
9
a=10
b=11
c=12
d=13
e=14
f=15

So in md5 for example which is hex the come in pairs of two like so

11-11-11-ff-ss-22-44-22-22
but it looks like
111111ffss22442222

So it’s the max value of 225

example

f(15) X f(15) = 225

Lets take for example a dodian password.

Password—ac443d7e72549bcf53ace3641e8f39cd(md5 hex)
salt--------d9960b594d951e47db933ab6f83ee234(md5 hex)

Now Subtract the salt from the password liek so

ac443d7e72549bcf53ace3641e8f39cd
-d9960b594d951e47db933ab6f83ee234

8820aa5e3dc1ff9b58f7190e02a74782

Or in other words the actual md5 of the real password.

Read full topic

item.title: Decimal, Octal, Hexidecimal
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

Read…

Converting between number systems 
* to convert a decimal number to a Hex, Octal or Binary number divide by the required base, the resulting remainders, in reverse order represent the required value

Convert Decimal 49 to Binary 49:

49 / 2 = 24      remainder: 1      ( 49 - 2*24 = 49 - 48 = 1)
24 / 2 = 12      remainder: 0      ( 24 - 2*12 = 24 - 24 = 0)
12 / 2 =  6      remainder: 0      ( 12 - 2* 6 = 12 - 12 = 0)
 6 / 2 =  3      remainder: 0      (  6 - 2* 3 =  6 -  6 = 0)
 3 / 2 =  1      remainder: 1      (  3 - 2* 1 =  3 -  2 = 1)
 1 / 2 =  0      remainder: 1      (  1 - 2* 0 =  1 -  0 = 1)

Proof: 110001 = 32+16+0+0+0+0+1 = 4910

Convert Decimal 49 to Octal 49:

49 / 8 = 6      remainder:  1    ( 49 - 8*6 = 49 - 48 = 1)
 6 / 8 = 0      remainder:  6    (  6 - 8*0 =  6 -  0 = 6)

Proof: 618 = (6 * 81) + (1 * 80) = 48 + 1 = 4910

Convert Decimal 49 to Hexidecimal 49:

49 / 16 = 3     remainder:  1     ( 49 - 16*3 = 49 - 48 = 1)
 3 / 16 = 0     remainder:  3     (  3 - 16*0 =  3 -  0 = 3)

Proof: 3116 = (3161) + (1160) = 48 + 1 = 4910

* in Java octal numbers are represented by 3 digits beginning with a zero, so 618 would be written as 061
* Hex numbers are always represented by 4 digits preceeded by 0x, so 3116 would be written as 0x0031
* when converting large decimal numbers to binary, the simplest method is to convert to Hex and then to binary

Convert 4823 to Hex:

4823 / 16 = 301 remainder: 7 (4823 - 16301 = 4823 - 4816 = 7)
301 / 16 = 18 remainder: 13 ( 301 - 16 18 = 301 - 288 = 13)
18 / 16 = 1 remainder: 2 ( 18 - 16* 1 = 18 - 16 = 2)
1 / 16 = 0 remainder: 1 ( 1 - 16* 0 = 1 - 0 = 1)

Hex value: 0x12D7
Hex value converted to binary: 0001 0010 1101 0111

* when converting large binary numbers, the simplest method is to convert to Hex and then to decimal

Convert Binary 0001 0010 1101 0111 to decimal

0001    1   1 * 163 = 4096
0010    2   2 * 162 =  512
1101    D  13 * 161 =  208
0111    7   7 * 160 =    7
                      ----
                      4823</blockquote>

Read full topic
